summary: An email from attorney Jeanne M. Christensen to an unspecified recipient, referencing a Reuters article about Leon Black's $62.5 million settlement with the US Virgin Islands related to the Epstein probe. The email expresses outrage that criminal charges have not been brought against Black and mentions an attorney representing ten women alleging sexual assault.

persons.name: Jeanne M. Christensen
persons.context: Author of the email, expressing outrage about the lack of criminal charges against Leon Black and referencing a settlement and allegations of sexual assault.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Described as having paid $62.5 million to the US Virgin Islands in a settlement related to the Epstein probe, with additional alleged payments to individual women, and facing allegations of sexual assault from multiple women.

connections.description: Christensen is commenting on legal matters involving Black, referencing his settlement and allegations, and urging an office (likely legal or prosecutorial) to examine the new information.

events.title: Reuters article on Leon Black settlement
events.description: Reuters publishes an article detailing Leon Black's $62.5 million settlement with the US Virgin Islands over the Epstein probe.

events.title: Christensen email sent
events.description: Attorney Jeanne M. Christensen sends an email expressing outrage over the lack of criminal charges against Leon Black and referencing the settlement and assault allegations.

keyFacts: Leon Black paid a $62.5 million settlement to the US Virgin Islands related to the Epstein probe.
The settlement reportedly does not include payments to individual women.
An unnamed lawyer is said to represent ten women alleging Leon Black sexually assaulted them.
The email expresses outrage that criminal charges have not been brought against Leon Black.
The communication is from Jeanne M. Christensen, a partner at WIGDOR LLP, urging an office to examine the new information.
